Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were immediately upgraded a beautiful apartment suite! The staff explained that there had been a cancellation and that they "felt sorry because we booked the smallest room in the place." Despite the upgrade, we still would have had a great time at this beautiful hotel. The staff were very friendly and offered wonderful suggestions, such as bike rentals, and where to go in Amsterdam (no lonely planet needed). I would definitely stay here again, if only to support the small business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pretty good facilities.”
Reviews.Author: kayleigh h Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment belonging to Hotel Bema, it was located near the Overtoom tram stop on Eerste Constantijn Huygenstraat. It was a bit of a pain having to go to the Hotel in order to be taken to the apartment, if I was going again I'd ask if they could meet us there. Although, it wasn't too bad as the hotel and apartment are only one tram stop apart. (If you're looking for the hotel, take the 197 bus from the airport, straight to Museumplein stop, it's really close to the hotel and saves about 50euros on a taxi). The staff were friendly and gave us a map and also had a rack of minicards we could look through for attractions' offers. Then they took us on the tram to the apartment and showed us around. The apartment was basic and a little old-fashioned, re-decorating would be nice. However, it was pretty clean, not much dust, no mould in the bathroom, clean sheets etc. The living room was a decent size but the sofa was tiny. There was a table and chairs for four to eat at. And a very tiny, but working TV. No hotel comforts like a phone or hairdryer. Clean towels were provided, (3 small bath towels and two hand towels between three people). There was a double bed in the bedroom, with no room for anything else! And a single we had asked for in the living room. There wasn't a wardrobe, just a coat rack. The kitchen had everything we needed- a hob, fridge (with freezer shelf), microwave, kettle, coffee maker, pans, utensils and cutlery. The stairs leading to the apartment make it only suitable for young and/or fit people who can climb a lot of steep stairs. The location is great as you can walk to Leidseplein or Museumplein in about 10 minutes. There's also a tram stop outside if you're feeling lazy. And a beautiful chocolate shop just nextdoor.

Reviews.Title: “Bema me up Scotty”
Reviews.Author: Daninboise
Reviews.Content: If you are in Amsterdam for the location for the museums and not the prostitutes then this hotel is fine. It's easy to get to and does the job. The rooms are large the breakfast is adequate the staff is fine. The shower didn't "feel" clean and the sink dripped. If we were going back, we would stay elsewhere. The price + location do not = a value for Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Friends on a budget”
Reviews.Author: jessica r Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Good sized room with comfy beds. We appreciated the breakfast included, and how heavy it must be to carry up the stairs! we had four of in the room with bathroom in the same room. Bathroom is small but very clean and tidy. great that we had towels, and they were even replenished. little walk from city, but could get the tram, but we didn't mind walking. the room could use a lick of paint, but for the price, we would recommend, and would stay again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good for young people”
Reviews.Author: LuMartini
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last weekend and we enjoyed our stay. Of course we are nearly 30years old, so if I was older this place will not be my choice :-) Other thing - this was my first stay in 1* category so it is not good to compare it with 3 or more stars hotels. This category has, of course, its problems and specifics Location of the hotel is quite good - you are near the Van Gogh museum, direct line to/from the airport is right in front of the hotel and you are comfortably in 15 minutes by walk in the centre (and nearest spots of interests :-)). Rooms were clean, we had a breakfast in the room rate, which was 3 toasts, 1 egg, 1 slice of ham and cheese, one marmelade and one butter. Coffee and juice included. Not so much, but you are in the low budget hotel don't you? :) Toilets and shower in the hall for all the rooms. Showers were clean but definitelly need to repaint! Staff pleasant, show us what we need, were polite and friendly. STAIRS to the first floor - that was something! I've never seen stairs like this and hardly can imagin that I have something else exept my hand luggage with me :-) Trust me, if you have problems with your legs or knees, try to find another place. I think you can find some photos in reviews below. So Hotel Bema is good low budget hotel for those, who want to be near the centre and who are finding a place only to sleep in. Reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing apartment”
Reviews.Author: Ruby2000
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Bema Hotel several times and really like it, so this time I thought I would pay a bit more and stay in their one bedroom apartment. The apartment was situated near Overtoom which is fairly handy for Leidseplein, museums, and Tram 1. Inside there was a comfy double bed, mini kitchen, shower room and dining area. Everything was spotlessly clean and the decor was nice. The main problem with this apartment was the noise levels. The trams and building work outside was very loud. Upstairs there was a family with small children who were very noisy. And next door seemed to have a party one one night which lasted until 3-30am. I took ear plugs which was lucky as otherwise I wouldn't have got any sleep at all.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously steep, narrow, stairs!”
Reviews.Author: Tregrub
Reviews.Content: To reach the main landing of the hotel enter a very narrow, step, claustrophobic staircase. Go up 40 treacherous steps. Turn and head up more stairs also curved and tight. Now add luggage and don't slip. Other than the stairs this place is great. Breakfast delivered to the room was good - toast, soft boiled egg, jam, coffee, tea. Majority of hotel staff pleasant. Hotel conveniently located near Van Gogh museum and easy to use bus routes. Nice view, thin single pane windows so it was noisy. We heard all the noise all night on the street. If traveling with anyone claustrophobic or just recovering from knee surgery skip this one because if the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: jeveiga
Reviews.Content: Nice location, near the best museums and not far form the city centre -- 15-20 minutes walking and 5-10 by tram. The staff is very nice and courteous. The house is old, but has it charms. The double room is spacious ando cozy, however rather cold in the winter. The bathroom is dark and even colder than the bedroom, without heater, and the shower has weak water pressure. Good breakfast serverd in the room. Overall a good hotel, but could be better.

Reviews.Title: “worth staying at”
Reviews.Author: jkgaliger
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised by our stay at the Hotel Bema. The staff was extremely helpful, even to helping carry our bags up the 59 stairs to the reception area. We had a large, quiet room with full bath, and the real surprise was the free breakfast inside our room. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly staff with excellent transport links!!”
Reviews.Author: Otisuk
Reviews.Content: The steep stairs at the entrance look daunting at first glance, but myself and gf never had a problem with them, even after all day walking and several drinks. The room was large, clean and warm. We were concerned about the shared toilet but never had to wait to use it, and it was always spotless...only negative would be that the toilet was rather compact. The breakfasts were fine, nothing bad about them and were delivered into the room with no hassle. The hotel is located in the museum district with good tram stops working a 30 second walk, and a nice open park to walk around. I would highly recommend the hotel and location to others wanting to visit Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms with beautiful view and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: adventuresaddict
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days. From the outside it looks like an old dutch warehouse but when you walk in its like WOW. Low budget for such big rooms with high ceiling and venetian style decorated. The location was perfect, its very close to the Van Gogh museum and Vondelpark and you can easily take any tram from the hotelstreet to amsterdam centre. The service is good, well variated breakfast on bed, more than you can eat. View is amazing and the rooms are clean and i cant stop saying how big they were.. The only thing that could bother people staying here is that the bathroom is very small. When you arrive you get the key of the entrance and you will not get bothered when you come in, so its a nice and private feeling you have here. Overall you will not regret staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Van Gogh”
Reviews.Author: Joahnna1407
Reviews.Content: It had the perfect location. Walking distance to the Van Gogh Museum and the park near it had the best view: very relaxing and "I AMsterdam" was within my grasp. =) The Fatboy burger sold by the park was VERY good! =) Good breakfast and good value for the money considering that it is Amsterdam. =) The flight of stairs though was quite a challenge! =)

Reviews.Title: “cheap and unique”
Reviews.Author: sadierocks
Reviews.Content: great hotel friendly staff and nicely decorated. room slightly damp and cold. but overall a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: EnglishLizzie999
Reviews.Content: Long steep flights of stairs. Friendly staff. A good breakfast served to the room on a tray each morning. If you want a double room don't stay in Room 2 - it's tiny - apart from the bed a small table and a washbasin there was barely enough floor room for our luggage. We asked to be moved after a couple of nights and went to Room 6 which was lovely - much bigger with an en-suite shower room and lots of space. For the money we thought it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DublinVinnieC
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here recently and for what you pay (â‚¬40) it is great value if you just want somewhere decent to crash in Amsterdam. The neighbourhood is nice with great tram and bus connections and adjacent to museums and a pretty little park . The bus to / from the airport drops you right outside the door and takes about 30 minutes. As previously reported, the hotel is old with basic facilities and extremely steep stairs in the typical Dutch style (think climbing a ladder) so not for the mobility challenged. I had a room with a wash basin and shared toilet / shower but there was never a problem acessing the bathrooms that were kept clean and presentable. I had a great sleep in a very comfortable bed. The breakfast was fine and the staff were all extremely friendly and helpful - top marks to them. Leaving luggaage is also not a problem after you check out, so you can come back later, collect your bag and hop on the airport bus outside - all very efficient and convenient. I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars for a one star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra971975
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights on a double room, with privat WC and shower, which I advise everybody that choses this hotel. The hotel is clean and smell like fresh painting. The stairs are very narrow but I guess that used to be a house, and in Amesterdam most houses have stairs like those ones. The bed was very confortable, and I enjoyed the breakfast being served at the room. It's a shame that the room does not have other curtains, because my boyfriend used to wake up at 4 AM with the sunlight...so I guess you should take some eyepads...

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: laurabMayo
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives great value for money. The hotel is spotless and staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is inculded in rate and is delivered to the room each morning. Hotel is in great location and very close to all public transport. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: TakeOff_N
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice small hotel in one of the most charming areas of Amsterdam. It definitely exceeded our expectations for a one-star hotel! The room with a private toilet was clean and cosy, and the staff was friendly. If you have problems with locomation it's good to notice that there's a very steep staircase but no elevator. Anyway, I had to say the price/quality ratio of this hotel is one of the best I've experienced!

Reviews.Title: “A little old charming house with nice stuff - a bit eun down”
Reviews.Author: AvHumbold
Reviews.Content: This is your typical small and old hotel. It has about zero amenities except for the ok breakfast they serve at your room due to a lack of a dining room. The don't make (or can't) any investments, so everything is old. But they keep it quite clean and the lady managing it is very charming and I guess she did a good job in picking friendly people as her personel. I went there for a trade show because on those occasions the hotels I pick for private trips (on which I never go during shows) are to expensive. It is located between RAI convention center and downtown so if your friend/spouse joins you, you can both reach your destinations quite easily. I would always prefer Bema over those anonymous hotel chains that you will get during shows at similar price points.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Ruby2000
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Bema quite a few times now and most recently last month, we love it and it has been recently decorated. It is always spotless and the staff are really friendly. They carried our bags for us and when a better room is empty than the one you booked they will let you stay in it for no extra cost. They helped us find train times and booked us a taxi and are always really polite. The rooms have a lot of rustic charm. If you want super modern you will not like it. Rather its retro wallpaper and fireplaces etc. As its an old tall house, there are a lot of stairs. If you are unable to climb stairs its not for you. The location is in an upmarket residential area right in the museum area. The tram, walking, cycling, are all pretty easy to get to the centre. Leidseplein is an easy walk. There are some nice shopping streets nearby and bicycle hire at the end of the street. There isn't a restaurant and breakfast is served to your room on a tray. My only complaint is that the breakfast is quite early. I would love it if they made it when we had woken up! Most often we take the tray then fall back asleep and when we wake up its gone cold! All in all, we have tried quite a few hotels in Amsterdam round about the same price or more and this is easily our favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, decent location”
Reviews.Author: Meltwaterfalls
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2006, and it was a pretty nice place, our room was very large and had a wah basin and a toilet next door. The staff were friendly, and the breakfast in bed was a real treat . Though I think it this service may have more to do with lack of space for a breakfast room than just great hospitality. The showers were good and there was never any problem with access, the decoration was a little old but that sort of added charachter, all in all we enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDavout
Reviews.Content: Our family had a very pleasant two night stay at this hotel. The room, linens, and towels were very clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is excellent, it is quiet and close to the city, especially the Van Gogh and Rijks Museums, it has good access to the highway/ring road, and the low cost long term parking at the Olympic Stadium is a short bus ride down the road. The cost was also very reasonable for what this is, as it is a BUDGET hotel in a typically expensive European city. There are also a lot of stairs, so please keep this in mind. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for young people coming to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Such alot of stairs!”
Reviews.Author: LindaAustralia10
Reviews.Content: This is an affordable place to stay, run by very friendly and helpful staff. It is quite central to everything, and in a quiet part of town. Breakfast is adequate, and other simple meals can also be ordered, which we found helpful on our first arrival there, as restaurants were not in the immediate vicinity. We enjoyed our stay here as it was easy to commute on our bikes into the heart of Amsterdam. The only real problem here, is like most of the accomodation in Amsterdam - alot of stairs and no lift - and we had very heavy large suitcases. However there was a very kind staff member who shouldered our bags for us. The sheets etc were clean, and rooms basic, but fine as not much time is spent in the room.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, nice room, mildly haunted bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: treehugger99
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my boyfriend in room #5, Sept. 2003. The room was small and a little in need of a makeover, but clean and happy. According to the website, it looks like the hotel has been redone since then. It has a lot of character, and tasty breakfast. The location was good, if you are interested in spending a lot of time at museums - its right near the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, and Vondelpark (which is a lovely park, just watch out for killer bicyclists), but is really no where near the red light district. If you believe in ghosts, keep reading. If not, stop reading: This place is certainly haunted. So are MOST places in Amsterdam, but this one in particular freaked me out. I wouldn't stay there again, because of that - but besides this, its a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: timpitts57
Reviews.Content: Positives--extremely quiet, no noise at all. Had a window overlooking a courtyard of apartments, a nice view. The room and shared bathroom/showers was clean. Breakfast in bed was nice and decent, nothing special. Very good price. Great location across from Museumplein. Negatives--this is the smallest room I have ever seen. Barely enough room to walk around the bed. The decor was absolutely terrible--my room looked nothing like the photos on the website. The television is tiny and mounted high up on the wall.

Reviews.Title: “I would not ever entertain this again”
Reviews.Author: MissAY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here AFTER looking at TripAdvisor, and took it that the Spanish reviewer was just being neurotic. Even thought I can't read Spanish - it is true. The place is NOT fit for habitation, and the 'greeting' member of staff was a rude [--], with all the charm of a pig. The man that showed us to our 'lodgings' - which was 15 minutes from reception, was nice but looked like a bum who was down and out on his luck . We were taken there by bus - charming as you can imagine! That was after being mislead that a car was coming to pick us up. Now - the room - we had to clean it - I am being as serious as a heart attack. Lucky one of my friends bought supplies - but we did spend a good 2 hours taking care of it. The bedlinen was stained and the carpets were grotty - I didnt walk barefoot - and tried to aviod touching anything unless necessary. Im not too choosy - Im just not a bum off the streets - and believe me a lot of bums make the effort to stay clean. The shower room and combined toilet had damp in it and was rotting. We were housed in a normal block of flats with the general public. What I am explaining is that this 'hotel' had just appeared to rent a flat - as if we were in Hackney! Believe me the ambience was the same as being in Hackney at 2am - just as dingy. The only saving grace was that Amsterdam was a hoot and Im going back this year - just not there! You have been warned people.

Reviews.Title: “Really close to the museums”
Reviews.Author: greengirl20
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good overall. Our room was very large (but we did have 4 people), the shower worked well, the museums were close, and food was delivered to our room. The downside was that the sheets were not totally clean and the bathroom was down the hall. Would recommend for a nice, cheap place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: gempul83
Reviews.Content: Me and a group of friends stayed in this hotel for 4 nights over the weekend as we wanted a cheap city break in amsterdam. When we arrived at the hotel we had to go up two steep staircases to reception so need to be able to do a fair few stairs if you want to stay here. On arrival the receptionist was friendly and gave us maps etc, we arrived early so left our luggage in reception until we could check in. The hotel is around 5-10 minute walk to liedsplein which is where all the bars/restaurants are and has good access to the trams which take you to central station and the red light district. Breakfast was served daily on a tray around half 8 someone knocks on your door with it but hey who wants to lie in bed all day anyway? The hotel was basic with a few patches etc on the carpet but it suited us for just a cheap place to kip; our toilet was shared but the corridors are short so there's not a long way to trek to the toilet. When we got to the hotel the hotel worker mentioned a discounted taxi to take us back to the airport, we though okay little did we know that on the day of departure the 'discounted taxi' was actually him driving us to the airport! but saved us 20 euros so whos complaining? Overall it was worth staying there just for some time in amsterdam the city was amazing, if you're on a budget this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Rooms in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: sarabc99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Museumplein. There is a bus stop directly in front of the hotel. Bus 370 goes to and from the airport. The receptionist has a time table and can tell you exactly what time the bus comes when you need to leave. The receptionist was wonderful! As soon as I arrived, she had me sit on a comfy couch while I filled out my paperwork. She then gave me a visitors guide with maps and showed me where most of the major attractions were located and where to find the best bars and restaurants. She also told me about a supermarket that was located just down the street. She was absolutely wonderful. The only bad part about this hotel is that you have to go up 2 very steep staircases to get to your room, so if you have mobility issues or are disabled, this would not be a good hotel for you. The rooms were very comfortable and clean. I had a doule bed, sink, small desk, tv, and closet. Breakfast was brought up to your room daily and included toast, jam, a hard boiled egg, cheese, meat, orange juice, and your choice of coffee, tea, or hot chocolate. Over all, I was very happy with my stay here. The hotel is in a really quiet area, which is very nice after leaving the noisy bar scene. The Leidensplein, which has a lot of bars, clubs, and restaraunts, is just a short walk away. For the most part, Amsterdam is so small, you can walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Small budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: milliebell
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights. The hotel is very small with only a few rooms. Staff spoke good English. They were friendly but could be quite abrupt at times. The rooms were clean. Mine had a shared bathroom, but it wasn't a problem. My room was very spartan and basic, but I couldn't complain for the very cheap price. Breakfast is served in your room at 8.30am - a wake up call every morning whether required or not. It was a good selection of cheese, eggs, toast, jam etc. The hotel doesn't have any other facilities - this is fine for me as I am not the type to stay in. I only needed my room to sleep in and I was out exploring the rest of the time. It is not in the centre, but tram 16 from centraalstation and a few buses stop outside, and tourist tram 20 - linking all of the major sites in Amsterdam - stops at the end of the street. The hotel is only a short walk away from the major musuems such as the Rijksmusuem and the Van Gogh musuem. This is a good quiet hotel. It is very small so you won't meet many people. Its small size means no large groups of screaming schoolkids -bliss, and it will not be suitable for stag and hen parties etc. This place really wouldn't suit romantics and honeymooners either. It also wouldn't suit those who want a resort within a hotel. For individual travellers who spend a lot of time sightseeing, looking for a very quiet but easy to reach and cheap place to stay, this is fine.
